name: Quote GOAT
description:
Quote GOAT "Who said it?"

Get a quote each round and guess who said it from a selection of three (more or less) famous personalities!

Try to make 10 correct guesses before running out of lives to become the Quote GOAT!

Features
  • 🗣️ Celebrity taunts: Ever wanted to get an "Impeccable!" from Albert Einstein or a "Not impressed..." from Kanye West? Now you can!
  • ♾️ Endless variety: With more than 75,000 quotes randomly picked from, you'll never get the same run twice!
  • 📅 Daily run mode: You have the option to play a run that is the same for all players each day. Try to beat your friends' scores!
  • 👪 Difficulty levels: Choose to only lose half a life per wrong guess, or play "true permadeath mode" and lose the whole run instantly!
  • 📊 Statistics: The game records how many 10-win runs you had and all your recent results!
  • 🌐 Play anywhere: Play the game right in your browser (even on mobile) or download the client.
    Note that the game requires an internet connection to retrieve the  author data from Wikidata.
Who would make this and why?

Fabian Fischer created the game to further explore the "trivia roguelike" genre, this time using a slightly more involved randomization process (see below) compared to his previous WikiArena.

Where do the quotes come from?

Quotes are retrieved from the amazing QuoteGarden API. The game then uses the authors' names as input for a secondary Wikidata query to find their descriptions and images.
